definition[0]: the movement of someone or something through the air without engine power, for example before a parachute opens after someone has jumped out of a plane
example[0]: The spacecraft is now in free fall towards the Earth.
definition[1]: a very fast and uncontrolled fall in the value of something
example[2]: The economy is in free fall.
definition[2]: when prices on a financial market go down suddenly or the economy gets worse very quickly
example[3]: After closing at $19.125 per share on Tuesday, the shares went into a free fall, ending at $14.50 at Friday’s close.
example[4]: Mexico’s peso went into free fall last December.
example[5]: He says that he is not worried by the free fall in housing prices.
